documents.title: regexp:test()
documents.summary: regexp:test() tests to see whether a string matches a specified regular expression.

body:
regexp:<mark>test</mark>() tests to see whether a string matches a specified regular expression.
regexp:<mark>test</mark>(<mark>test</mark>String, regExpString[

, flagsString])
<mark>test</mark>String
The string to <mark>test</mark>.
regExpString
The JavaScript style regular expression to evaluate.
flagsString
EXSLT - REGEXP:<mark>TEST</mark>
title: regexp:<mark>test</mark>()

documents.title: Smoke test
documents.summary: A smoke test consists of functional or unit tests of critical software functionality. Smoke testing comes before further, in-depth testing.

body: A smoke <mark>test</mark> consists of functional or unit tests of critical software functionality.
"Can you save a simple blank new <mark>test</mark> user account?"
title: Smoke <mark>test</mark>

documents.title: XRHitTestResult
documents.summary: The XRHitTestResult interface of the WebXR Device API contains a single result of a hit test. You can get an array of XRHitTestResult objects for a frame by calling XRFrame.getHitTestResults().

title: XRHit<mark>Test</mark>Result

documents.title: XRHitTestSource
documents.summary: The XRHitTestSource interface of the WebXR Device API handles hit test subscriptions. You can get an XRHitTestSource object by using the XRSession.requestHitTestSource() method.

title: XRHit<mark>Test</mark>Source

documents.title: URLPattern: test() method
documents.summary: The test() method of the URLPattern interface takes a URL string or object of URL parts, and returns a boolean indicating if the given input matches the current pattern.

documents.title: RegExp.prototype.test()
documents.summary: The test() method of RegExp instances executes a search with this regular expression for a match between a regular expression and a specified string. Returns true if there is a match; false otherwise.

body:
("foo"); // true
// regex.lastIndex is now at 3
regex.<mark>test</mark>("foo"); // false
// regex.lastIndex is at 0
regex.<mark>test</mark>("barfoo

"); // true
// regex.lastIndex is at 6
regex.<mark>test</mark>("foobar"); // false
// regex.lastIndex is at 0
regex.<mark>test</mark>("foobarfoo");
title: RegExp.prototype.<mark>test</mark>()
